website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, solid metal kit with a smooth glide action. Rails are easy to install even if the wall itself is a challenge.
pros: Easy installation, even with uneven or out-of-plumb walls
Metal hardware is attractive and solid
Instructions are thorough and easy to follow
cons: Holes drilled 16 inches on center, but door frame studs may not match
Original lag bolts may need to be replaced for concrete installation

customer_reviews.title: Unreal quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very, very rarely do I give a 5 star review, but this product deserves 6 stars. First off, the quality is that of any $200-$300 kit you would buy at a home improvement store. The rails are straight and sturdy and powder coated. The bearings are smooth. I have used two of these now and they work great. Installation is straightforward and simple. One thing I have noticed in other reviews is folks commenting on the door bumping as you roll it....if your door bumps you have the rail spacers backwards, the fat side goes to the wall, not the rail (see the photo).
customer_reviews.author: aaluck

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, I'm a cabinetmaker and build quite a bit of barn doors. This is the fourth project I used this hardware on and have had zero issues. For the price this is an excellent choice
customer_reviews.author: Lucas P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Best price around
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, and very heavy and high quality. Holes are pre drilled at 16 inches on center. THAT'S my only complaint. THIS always has to mount over a door frame, and when anybody builds a door frame there will always be a variation in where the studs will be, so you will never get the holes to match up no matter what you do. I had to use a wooden runner, which is no big deal and looks good. Just keep in mind that the pre drilled holes won't match up to your stud locations.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I would buy again. Good quality. I didn't think about the max thickness of the door the included screws support (1 3/4). Built my own door, and it was thicker so I just went to Lowes and purchased longer bolts. No big deal. If I had to do it again, I would have had a helper to assist me in keeping the bar level. Most of the troubles I had were due to human error. The quality is great for the price. I purchased a different floor roller on Amazon, instead of cutting a groove into the bottom of the door. Didn't have the right tools to cut the groove.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M Worm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Super Duper Quality & Functionally! See Video Inside!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! Awesome packaging, Awesome Quality! Looks nice and is super quiet! Awesome buy highly recommend! See my posted video review on the hardware 😉 👍🏼 Please don't forget to hit Like/Helpful button!!! Update: I hope the posted video quality has come out good? I see from reviewing my video here looks a bit pixelated and not sure what bc I recorded it in HD 1080p. I think the Compression upon uploading here to amazon might have taken the quality from it..if it keeps happening I might upload to a YouTube account and share the links here! Any questions about the hardware kit pls email me my email is under our profile! Have a great week!
customer_reviews.author: Just A Couple

customer_reviews.title: Faulty description
customer_reviews.text: I would like to have known that the roller wheels were plastic. The description stated that the materials were high quality steel. I had this mounted in my laundry room and the track lighting literally melted one of the wheels. I tried to find a contact number or email for SmartStandard so I could replace the wheel but there is none to be found. If the company will send me a new wheel, i’ll Be happy to update this review and star rating.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

customer_reviews.title: Great product - worked prefectly.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Installed the door this afternoon. Ran into the usual problems: the walls were neither plumb nor plane, the door opening was flush against a wall so there was no room to put a door stop on the rail, there was trim on the opening that the door ran against, studs weren't where they should have been, etc. Despite that the installation was smooth, and I could adapt the product easily. I found the instructions clear and accurate. All the hardware needed (plus lots more) was supplied, and it all fit perfectly. Good heavy metal. I'd buy it again if I ever need to hang another door.
customer_reviews.author: Oz in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use. We put a board behind the hardware so we could drill the holes for the screws anywhere and didn't have to line up the studs. That, mixed with our diy barn-style door, I love the look! I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Culp

customer_reviews.title: Good price and easy install
customer_reviews.text: Do what the others reccomend: 1. Install the header board 2. Go ahead and buy a seperate floor guide... you will buy it eventually A seperate handle is not necessary depending on how your door is designed. But, I expect you will also need to go ahead and buy it. Easy to install if you are used to using drills and measuring carefully. Follow the measurement guides that they include and you should be fine. My door was heavy and was not easy to weild around by myself... but still dooable. Good purchase and would do it again with no concerns.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: IT'S TRASH NO INSTRUCTIONS NO WAY TO KNOW THE MEASUREMENTS AND WHERE TO LOCATE THINGS. Another box with NO INSTRUCTIONS getting tired of this, add instructions or get another job.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Oldham

customer_reviews.title: I slid the door open, only to find.....the truth.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this sliding barn door kit to mount a wide, riged indoor closet door. The door weighs about 20 lbs. and this barn door kit works great. Installation was easy and straight forward. Admittedly, I'm a clever, irresistibly handsome, guy who has spent a life building and repairing all kinds of stuff; but I do think even the most basic handyman skills can get this sliding barn door hardware kit installed with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: WhoopieDoodle

customer_reviews.title: overall good bang for the buck, but two complaints
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and heavy material. Was a little angry that the rail came in two 4ft sections that had to be screwed together. It made it quite difficult to get everything level. Also the floor guide is crappy plastic, needed to order something better offline. Other than that I don't really have any complaints. Would still recommend because its about a 1/3 of the price if you try to get this hardware at a lowes or Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: So smooth, even with 200 lb. door
customer_reviews.text: We built a door because we needed to cover an opening of 48" so this rail set was perfect for the space. He added some washers behind the spacers because our door was pretty thick. It glides so perfect! We did the math before purchasing and the wood added up to about 200 pounds. Slides like it's 20 lbs. So very happy! It's our bathroom and we live in Louisiana so only time will tell how the rails will handle humidity and moisture. One week in, I'm super satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny C-Roc

customer_reviews.title: Good suggestion for others that do not have studs every ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as the more expensive hardware found in the big box stores. We did have to add a piece of wood behind the hardware to secure it to the wall. Good suggestion for others that do not have studs every 16", which is required to hang the hardware. We tried toggle bolts, but the rail supports sank into the drywall due to the weight of the wood door.
customer_reviews.author: supergrover2ptO

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality. Allen tool doesn't even fit.
customer_reviews.text: this comes in two pieces that are put together (2x3.3') The Allen key tool to tightening the door stoppers doesn't even fit or those little bolts are damaged. you get what you pay for. I would recommend to spend a bit more and get a good quality item. Might send this back if I can't find new stopper bolts or an Allen key that fits.
customer_reviews.author: AJM

customer_reviews.title: Bent
customer_reviews.text: Bar came in completely bent/curved far from strait, opened after 30 days now I’m stuck! Do not buy! Homedepot has for same price better quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great door track but must modify stops.
customer_reviews.text: Operates very nicely and great appearance. Low profile fits where there is very little over head clearance. Does NOT fit for 36” - 40” doors without modifying stop location to outside the attachment posts. See pictures for what I did to make it fit. For safety, I added an angle bracket so stops could not slide off the end if the set screw came loose. My door was 38” and door opening 36”. I was able to install it with the top of the door only 5-1/4” from ceiling so it works well with low clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Annette

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate 2 pcs rail connection style
customer_reviews.text: This is the bad style of 2 piece track connection that causes issues with rolling the door, when it hits the connection it causes issues. There is better style that uses a connection plate. Look for that design or even better a solid track. Can be found for less or same price
customer_reviews.author: maryann yates

customer_reviews.title: looks great, buy longer than you might think
customer_reviews.text: loved this generally - the little things that are supposed to "stop" the door don't have enough grip to really stop it by themselves. I'd've needed about another foot and would have put them in front of the huge lag screws if I could, this set was large enough for my door according to the measurements but will have to reinforce later. Other than that this looks great and is really heavy duty and nice.
customer_reviews.author: Peter John

customer_reviews.title: Horrible instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve installed a lot of door is over 30 years of construction work. This is the worst hardware I’ve ever seen. The instructions at just plain wrong. If you follow them you will end up with your door to far below the rail. Then the little keepers on top of the door will not keep the door fee I’m jumping off the rail. Also be sure your mounting bolts aren’t at each side of your opening or you won’t be able to stop The door at the correct location. Also be sure you cut the rails off evenly so that the seam in the rail is in the middle. None of these tips are in the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Hegar

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The two rails are supposed to fit together to be one piece but the product I got the two pieces DEFINITELY don’t fit together. So it’s going back. I ordered another because this product has good reviews but if the next one is defective I give up and it’ll get one star. This is the single 6.6 ft option.
customer_reviews.author: picou.ek

customer_reviews.title: Strong, modern, & pretty
customer_reviews.text: This matte black matched well with the door handle I got. It was easy to install in the sense that they don’t have a ton of confusing pieces & the directions are pretty clear. We have never installed a barn door before so that’s where our “ease of install” was lost. But this kit was a great buy for our door. I really like that the amount the door slides can be adjusted anywhere since our door was a bit smaller. We installed this over a 1 x 6 bc of framing and it worked great. This was a great buy & the price was much better than other ones out there that offered less in the kits.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda V.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting for the price
customer_reviews.text: I expected to open the box to find cheap poorly painted pieces that would just barely get the job done, with cheap plastic for every part that could be. This thing is HEAVY. Every piece of it is really solid, and even the spacers are heavy steel that is powder coated flawlessly. I'm building a door out of reclaimed wood and it's going to be pretty heavy. I'm not worried at all that this will hold up. It says it's heavy duty and it really means it. And for half the price of other similar kits, you really can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect instructions led to a mounting error.
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions meticulously. Unfortunately, the installation directions for where to drill the mounting holes for the door brackets were incorrect. When I went to hang the door (almost the last step), instead of having the appropriate floor clearance, the door hung flush with the floor. Nothing like having to repair a $400 brand new solid oak custom made door. I fixed the holes but both my client and I were very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install, but...
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was almost 10 days late, when it offered delivery on two days. It came with cero instructions, no references to what part is for what. What it helped me was the promo video for the product on Amazon. And arrived missing one component, it was supposed to arrive with 4 separators that separate the rail from the door frame and for big screws to mount on the door frame, but arrived with 3 separators only. So arrived with no instructions, late and missing a component, otherwise it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: David Arcos

customer_reviews.title: You can find better quality than this model
customer_reviews.text: I have previously ordered and installed barn door hardware (same price point) from Amazon with excellent results. This one is NOT the same quality. One of the two rails arrived bowed and required extra work on my part to straighten (I wish I had taken a photo). Door does not glide smoothly and “catches” just a bit at every bolt. A benefit of this design issue is that the will stay in place if you want to leave partially open. Directions not nearly as good as directions in other kits. I’d recommend you look at another system as there are better ones on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent materials, packaging and instructions
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with how well this was packaged -- orderly, padded and heavily taped. Unlike many of the heavy hardware products I have purchased on Amazon, this one had no chance for parts to escape their bindings and roam aimlessly in the box. The price was fantastic, given how much high quality material was provided. The rolling access panel door project was completed in a bit more than an hour and the clearly illustrated directions made this a breeze to install. I would go out of my way to find another use for rolling barn door kit just because the result was great and left no bruises along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Gartner

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This hardware kit does exactly what it says on the tin. Don’t try to avoid getting a header board... you will need one. Paint it before mounting it. The spacers between the header board and the bar itself are not symmetrical. One side has a lip, and that side needs to go against the header board. If you put the lip against the bar, the wheels will bounce over the spacers and the door will not glide smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: ** 2" WIDE BARN DOOR **
customer_reviews.text: I made my own door out of old deck wood and it was a bit over 2" wide and super heavy. I had to counter sink the bolts into the door about a 1/2 inch but all worked according to plan and the hardware looks great and does NOT struggle holding the weight. I also used ... HANDLE:  BOTTOM GUIDE:
customer_reviews.author: Duke Boys

customer_reviews.title: Installation Manual is Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I followed the manual exactly and went to hang the door and it was dragging the ground. I came to find that the dimensions for installing the door hangers are wrong for the configuration I purchased. The manual shows that the holes should be drilled 1 9/16" from the top of the door. I later come to find that there is an image on the amazon product listing showing that this should actually be 2". I now have to re-drill the holes, and patch & paint the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought it for the sliding barn door I made for our walk-in closet. We were able to cut it down to a custom length using a grinder with metal cutting wheel. We then sprayed it with flat black rattle can spray paint, being careful to mask it off so there wasn’t obvious overspray. I bought a separate floor roller, which worked nice. It cones with a bottom track slider piece, but I wouldn’t want to use it as it is very small and would require some definite precision to pull off. Overall a great buy and a DIY build.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful - Check Dimensions Given
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to verify the height dimensions given in the instructions against your own door opening. In my case I followed the given dimensions exactly (I mean EXACTLY) and still ended up with a fabricated door that I had to trim about 1/2" off the bottom of to make it fit. That said, the components were beautifully packed, everything was there, everything (except the dimensions) worked, and the instructions were written in fine English - and I did end up with a nicely operating door.
customer_reviews.author: rsd22

customer_reviews.title: Amazonbasics has a big QA problem!
customer_reviews.text: I always trusted Amazonbasics brand, but this product really disappoint me. See above, the rail comes in two section, so you need to connect them. First I found the connector missing so I requested a return. And, later I found the 4 holes on the connecting missing. You need the holes to attach the connector with four screws. It is a good design and sturdy construction. But the quality control is very bad. Amazon should have its own QA staff at factory floor to check everything. Just so unbelievable that can happen to the trusted brand - Amazonbasics!
customer_reviews.author: G. F. Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I will start with saying my husband installed this and it did take him awhile but it looks great! He first installed without placing a board on the wall but it ended up hitting the door trim awkwardly so he installed with white board as pictured. For the overall price i would recommend, also got the door handles from Amazon. We bought a $100 door, i painted it and we installed with this kit. Saved us quite a bit of money. Love the looks, but cannot comment on difficulty of install, my husband is handy though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy material, and the instructions were better than most. It's extremely easy to slide our doors (over 100 pounds each). Even a smaller child could do it if neccessary. The product is also relatively quiet when using, and the door stops and atabalizers that came with the product are great too. used 2 of these for an outdoors sliding door. If you do that, I'd reccommend having a way to protect the metal from rusting. Ours hasn't rusted yet, but you might as well be safe now and not sorry later. Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: BenC

customer_reviews.title: 1 hour to install. Measure twice and drill once! Tools needed!
customer_reviews.text: Apply spacers in 2 different ways. If you want speed bumps or position brakes, place metal riser w/flat part against the bar so the door slider will rest at these points. If you want a smooth slide w/out bumps or are placing it in tight quarters, place spacers w/the flat part against the wall instead and the door won't have to slide over them. It was a great gift and buddy/friend hangout and install job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: This set was exactly what we were looking for at a fraction of the price in big box stores (think the orange home improvement store). My husband had no trouble putting this door up. The instructions were clear and everything we needed was included minus of course, some tools.
customer_reviews.author: Shop4deals

customer_reviews.title: Easy bracket to work with and seems durable
customer_reviews.text: These things aren't rocket science to install if you have any mechanical aptitude whatsoever. If you don't, find someone who does and have them install this for you. We just recently installed this (and a shorter one in the laundry) in our new house so no real long term use yet. Just make sure you either mount the bracket to studs or install a header board to studs then the bracket to the header board. You want it to be mounted well to support door weight.
customer_reviews.author: avguy-ar

customer_reviews.title: End piece doesn't fit - door slides right off
customer_reviews.text: Everything aside from this end piece installed nicely and looks great. The end piece has a metal part that's jutting out too far where the screw should go in - this prevents us from putting this piece on the bar to hold the door in place so it doesn't go flying off the hardware every time we slide it open. I'm unable to find their contact information on their website. If we can get a replacement piece that fits then I'll go ahead and update this product review to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tammerz21

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product. I read all of the other reviews and was super happy when I bought this! It's very strong and really affordable. Brick and mortar stores would offer this for $100-150 easy!!! The installation was a breeze!! If you're doing this on a pie.r and beam home, I highly advise that you do NOT follow the instructions on how high to mount this! You're better off eyeballing and using a level!!! Also, throw away the shitty floor guide and buy yourself the versatile one that has a wheel. Cutting a kerf onto the bottom of the door for a cheap floor guide isn't even worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great price, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Added lots of character to my recently renovated 1954 house. I zipped tied it so it can’t move. It’s more Aesthetics than functional for me. Like a piece of art. I didn’t want my guests, especially with small kids, to move it back and forth. It was a fraction of the price of the one at HD, and looks just as nice. Although my door was 3 ft wide, I got the 6’6” rail. The extra 3” on both sides looks nice in my opinion (see photos). Easy to install. I bought the matching door handle. A+
customer_reviews.author: David San Diego

customer_reviews.title: I decided that the Smart Standard door hardware was the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I was determined not to pay a fortune for sliding barn door hardware! After doing much searching and reading multiple reviews, I decided that the Smart Standard door hardware was the way to go. Not only is it easy to install, but it looks great, and operates very smoothly. The only thing needed was to cut down the screws that attached to the door, because they were rubbing against the wall. This is no fault to the hardware, but to the construction of the door opening in our home.
customer_reviews.author: Chunky Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Don’t follow the instructions, they’re absolute crap
customer_reviews.text: Directions are absolutely worthless. Followed them to a T AND I’m a master carpenter, not even remotely close to correct. Had to wing it on my own to get it to hang correctly. Also the directions don’t take into account whether you are hanging over a carpeted area or hard surface. Not pleased. Had someone inexperienced tried this alone I could absolute see them chucking this whole track out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much more solid than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for what appears to be a very quality product. Installed fairly easily in my admittedly odd scenario. We have a very odd living room layout, which makes it tough to balance the layout for all the doors and windows, as well as keeping enough space for furniture, TV, our fireplace, and room for walking around. As such, I got fed up and decided to hang our tv over our giant window. This sliding barn door hardware coupled with a sturdy TV mount and some DIY rigging yielded awesome results! I gained 2ft of space in the living room, as well as the ability to slide the TV and the center channel speaker around as needed for optimal viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Craig H

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Install went smooth
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and seems to be made well. I wasn’t too keen on the rail being two pieces, but it is secure at the joint. Only had it installed for a week so I’m not sure if its longevity, but everything appears to be built to last. We removed a hinged door that swung in our boys bathroom and installed this to add more space. It made a huge difference. We left the trim on the jamb and added a header board for the track to mount to because there is little chance the pre drilled holes will line up with studs. The instructions were written well and all their measurements they said to use were spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Kacz

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Sliding door kits ridiculously priced at big box hardware, this was a much better value. Have already ordered a second one and installed it. Only thing I would do different if I was installing another would be to use a 1/2 by 4inch by length of track, board behind the track so the brackets wouldn't sink into the drywall as I used solid wood heavy doors will probably take them down and redo them right. If it said anything about that in the instructions my bag never read the instructions just saw something on TV that showed a board behind the bracket and realized my mistake
customer_reviews.author: john hanna

customer_reviews.title: Useless bolts that dont work.
customer_reviews.text: The bolts that join the 2 tracks or rails together are a joke. I went to hardware store and had to buy all new hardware. Dont buy this unless you want useless parts. Very annoying and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Would have given 5 stars but....
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy, easy to install, and good for your money. I would have rated 5 stars but the anti-jumpers are too thin. By 1/4 of an inch to my cauculations. This door is not only decorative but used to keep people out. Even though I followed the instruction and have no gap on the floor, the door can be pulled off the roller bar because the anti-jumper bumpers are too small. I would have love to give this product 5 stars. It look great but doesn't function 100 percent to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz/ Gabe Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hardware. The head of a lag screw snapped ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap hardware. The head of a lag screw snapped off as I was tightening it. The nuts on back of the door scrape on the wall when the door opens and closes. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: jerome brady

customer_reviews.title: Nice style, might have to rig it a bit to get to fit your custom door
customer_reviews.text: Man this product is good! 4 stars only because the little weight/buffer that comes with it to go on the bottom of the door actually doesn’t fit on homemade custom doors. So to keep the door from swinging open, we had to rig it & screw the rubber buffer into the floor. But design & style gets 5 stars because it is very cute . We also had to cut down the metal with a saw to get it to fit the custom door that we made.
customer_reviews.author: G.J.C.P

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: great price for a great product. packaged very well. I purchased the single door track. I've hung a double before so I knew the deal but the instructions sent with this item are typed in approx 6 font so need to have a magnifying glass to read, other than that the product is stellar. I didn't decrease the stars bc of the instructions bc it's not warranted, the product makes up for it. finally, the price definitely makes this a fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fam

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy!!! If you do, dont use their directions!!!
customer_reviews.text: This company has no way on their website to contact them. Terrible instructions!!! If you follow the directions and drill your top hole 1 9/16" down from the top of your door like they say, you've just ruined your $300 door..!! And then you have no recourse because they have no way to be contacted. Truly disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Weller

customer_reviews.title: It's a sliding barn door bracket
customer_reviews.text: It's a barn door. I didn't want to spend that much money buying from a store, so ordered online. It was easy to install, directions made sense, and it holds the door up easily, and slides smoothly. Very happy with it, and the brackets are also helping to hold the door together, so can't complain. It would have been nice if they had included a paper template for mounting the hardware, but I survived without it.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money and everything we needed in one kit!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and they’re right, this is the best barn door kit at the best price. We wanted to add some rustic charm to our log cabin which already had a hidden sliding pocket door to the walk in closet. The kit worked well for us because we didn’t. We didn’t need a header since we were installing it directly into the cedar wall. Even the little plastic piece that mounts to the floor worked without having to cut a channel in the bottom of the door. Quick and easy to install both to the wall and to the door and intuitive as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this cant be beat. Well made. In certain application this would be an easy install. The mounting holes are pre drilled. If you have a stud exactly there you are golden. Everything about my installation was customized, but the hardware itself is sturdy. I would have given 5 stars except for the cheap plastic and woefully inadequate plastic floor mounted door guide. I used a door guide from a sliding door that was made of metal. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: HenryBoy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built product.
customer_reviews.text: Weekend DIY'er here. The wife wanted a barn door because that's the thing she sees the most on a certain Home and something channel. No problem, I'll be the hero and take a crack at it. Bought this product because the price at the home improvement stores was ridiculous. It was a wise decision...not only did I save a boatload of money, but it turned out to be a very solid, sturdy, well built product. Not really rocket surgery to put up and it's been a few weeks now and it's still standing tall and looking good.
customer_reviews.author: BENJAMIN GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: No issues out of the box, castors roll smooth and quiet for metal on metal
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to installing these on a custom made door and I love it. This kit was informative with the instructions, for as much as you need them. It's relatively straight forward, just make sure you have a good plumb leveler or even a 5ft level to ensure it's all lined up. The hardware was packaged well. Even though my package was a little banged up on the outside, nothing inside showed any sign of mistreatment. If I ever put up another barn door I know which product I'll be getting!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Krajewski

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality kit for the price. Looks excellent once installed!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this kit is made very well especially for the price. It's heavy steel and very good quality. It's clearly about half the cost of other kits that we looked at in local retail stores. We bought a slab door and stained it so for about $150 and some labor, we ended up with a nice detail item in a condo we were renovating. I had a hard time finding the actual installations instructions but after others commented about that issue, someone provided a link for much better instructions. I'd buy this kit again without question. Take your time on the installation. It's tricky to do it right but the end result is well worth the work!
customer_reviews.author: S. R.

customer_reviews.title: You must have a 6 ft of clearance to hang this
customer_reviews.text: I have a 56 inch in-set wall to my closet this rail is 6ft with no instruction or note of that on the product description or on the directions
customer_reviews.author: Dani Gee

customer_reviews.title: Joint creates a bump
customer_reviews.text: The point where the two bars attach creates an obvious bump when the door rolls across it. Can’t believe I didn’t see anyone mention this. Otherwise the quality is great, but I expected a smooth rolling track. This is not.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Poor installation instructions. Measurements didn't line-up as instructions instructed. Hardware on the backside of the roller bracket scratch against wall, leaving behind a black line. Nuts on backside of roller hardware interfere with header lag screws, leaving you with a door that doesn't slide. Rail has holes every 16" to mount to your studs. However, every homeowner knows that their studs are never EXACTLY 16" apart. Instead of holes, the rail should have slots. Please be aware you'll be forced to install a header board ($38 including lag screws) which are not included. I'd recommend a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 1

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the quality of all the parts in this inexpensive barn door rail kit. Everything fit perfectly. All parts are heavy duty and fit together nicely. The installation instructions are barely adequate for a novice carpenter though, usable only because of fairly good illustrations. This kit has very smooth action when opening/closing the door. I did use this with a SmartStandard door and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer DGD

customer_reviews.title: Price right
customer_reviews.text: The price was great compared to local stores, you can read the directions but measure for yourself, if door is less than 1 3/4" go buy replacement bolts, the measurement for installing are off, only use as a guide before you drill ANY holes in your door measure, measure, measure. and measure again, 2" from top is dead center of screw in their own door. H+1 11/16 will put door down on floor not 3/8 off floor. Just saying, read the instructions, measure for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: P******** R***

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: In love with this kit! Our door is huge, we have a 6ft opening. The hardware had instructions on how to install and my husband said it was clear. The door was custom built and is heavy about 250lbs (within the limit) and it glides on the hardware like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy looks great awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Project isn’t complete yet but the hardware looks amazing , we did need to mount it on wood for the spacing of the door. Also I did purchase a different floor holder (not sure what’s it’s called ) for the door to slide in the floor. The one that came with this isn’t great . Shopped around Home Depot, Lowes, wayfair . Best price for sure !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought barn door hardware at Home Depot for $146. When I came home I went on Amazon to see if I could find it cheaper. Much to my surprise we got it on Amazon for $35.99. I was skeptical at first...thought it would be made cheap and look and feel cheap. Boy was I wrong. It was very sturdy and heavy and it look great on the barn door we made.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: High quality and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered earlier than expected. Instructions are a little confusing measurement wise so it might be beneficial to have someone double check so you don’t drill too many holes. Very high quality and smooth rolling. I am very impressed with the quality. One thing To note if building your own doors is it cannot be any thicker than 1 3/4” thick which I didn’t know ahead of time but turns out I built it thinner than that luckily!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing rail. Smooth glide.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Very solid and easy to install. I used a backboard and everything went well. The 70lb door slides like butter on this sucker! I do wish the instructions had advised a bit more clearance when installed over carpet. I went 1/8” higher but wish I had gone 1/4” since the door does drag on the carpet a little and will wear it out over time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B.

customer_reviews.title: Durable heavy track. Looks and feels amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! For the price you can’t beat it. The bar comes in two pieces and is really heavy and not cheap. The door tools smoothly and would recommend to anyone. Have enough clearance to clear my outlet in the wall. I just used a wall plug with the cord running down instead of out and it works perfect! The bumpers are smooth and easy to go on. Everything about this set up is great. If I had to order again I would. Everyone who sees it loves the look. Good product!! Install can be tricky with all the measuring but ones you get it down once your golden.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not for the novice...
customer_reviews.text: This is not something I would recommend for a novice if you plan to depend on the instructions that come with it. Be sure to do some homework using YouTube or some other media. The instructions that come with it is a very small pamphlet with tiny lettering and is skimpy on details. It is sturdy and a good quality for the money. Be sure to do your homework!
customer_reviews.author: Maria T. Erdo

customer_reviews.title: Great track!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an inexpensive, low profile track and this fit the bill. Door moves very smooth and looks great. I installed on a 1x4 board as i wasn't positive that the homes in the track would like to with studs and it looks great. Only con (and it's minor) is that the 6'6" track didn't have an alignment/joining bracket, but the ends were keyed to keep lined up. It made it a little about to install, but no big deal. End result is perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product! But learn from our mistakes!
customer_reviews.text: So if you think you can mount this to a wall without the wood beam, think again. The door we used was a hollow light weight door and it ripped the anchors right out of the drywall. My husband had to hang it a second time once we purchased a wood plank. Other than that it looks awesome and slides so smoothly. We get so many compliments and makes a tiny closet look much bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Rail comes in two pieces
customer_reviews.text: This works and is hanging a significantly heavy custom made door. However, it was tricky to install because it came in two pieces. We'll see if it is a problem over time as the door gets a lot of use. The two pieces had to meet perfectly and be exactly level. It was definitely a two person job to install.
customer_reviews.author: MoTeach

customer_reviews.title: Good product but holes are 16" apart-check your studs first!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sturdy track. Unfortunately they have predrilled the holes for 16" studs and if you are renovating an old house like we are that doesn't work very well! We had to find other wall anchors or redrill the holes-my husband found some silver wall anchors that were big enough to work, now I just have to remember to get black paint!
customer_reviews.author: dfoss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble figuring out how to install it, the instructions that came with it were very clear but are specific for the perfect scenerio of having studs 16 in on center where i installed it was not the case so i had to diviate from the instructions however now that it is up it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good Find
customer_reviews.text: The exact same style and model will cost upwards of three times as much from a home improvement store. This one is easy to assemble and install if you follow the directions that come with it. FYI watch your measurements carefully. If you get it too close to the door frame it will drag.
customer_reviews.author: RollinggirlTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: Our bathroom is small and when the door opened into the bathroom it took even more space. I figured a barn door would not only save us space in our tiny bathroom but give it a nice look at the same time. I purchased this kit and we used the door that was already our bathroom door. This came together so easy and looks so beautiful!! Nice look and quality!! Love the new look! Works for what I was wanting!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Parrick

customer_reviews.title: Quality Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Not too difficult to figure out how to install, sturdy, quality hardware. Looks nice. One small gripe is the door retainer that goes on the floor. It's plastic and not very tall. I had to make one, this one was too short and I didn't like that it was plastic when everything else was heavy metal.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price, impossible to believe!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how, but those guys are offering an awesome product at an awesome price. I bought the same product for $100, then I bought this one not expecting too much based on the price.... what a surprise!!! I’m ordering 2 more sets to build 2 more doors. Thanks guys and congratulations, I’m a carpenter and yor product is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: So glad I picked this instead of one of those really expensive ones. This track is perfect! Instructions are easy to follow and it was a breeze putting it up by myself. The track is extremely heavy duty. I would recommend this product over and over again. So glad I purchased
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Horrible instructions,  descent product
customer_reviews.text: Besides the directions being completely useless, the actual product is of good quality. Easy enough to install, another set of hands would have been nice but all in all, i would recommend to a friend. As far as longevity of the product, only time will tell but the door slides easily open and closed and its holding about 100 lbs. Side note, the enclosed hardware is garbage so be sure to predrill your holes otherwise youll snap the lags cause they're cheap chinese metal
customer_reviews.author: ryan kelley

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust the measurements their directions!
customer_reviews.text: Really poor direction. I highly recommend using your own measurements. The measurements in their directions are way off and cost me time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built!!
customer_reviews.text: This hardware is very heavy duty and well made. It looks really good installed on my barn door. I was worried if the hardware would fit because the door ended up being 40 3/4 inches wide. However, it did fit even though this hardware is designed for doors 40” wide or less. Don’t expect to get much support if you have specific questions regarding the hardware or installation. Support is only through Amazon, no support from manufacturer. Product and instructions are good quality so chances are you won’t need support (unless you build your door a little too wide like I did, lol)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Cust0mer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful door
customer_reviews.text: Amazing door definitely worth the price. The first pair came a little bit damaged (I think it was a fedex fouls because it looked like they damaged it in transportation and repacked it so the main box it came in looked in tacked and when we opened it the second box was destroyed) I contacted costumer service and the problem was solved the same day. 100% recommend. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Karolina

customer_reviews.title: 5 ft came bend had to send it back
customer_reviews.text: The 5 ft. came in one piece bent. Had to send it back. Usually have a good experience buying from Amazon and getting my items not damaged, on time and new. But it was heavy. Went ahead and ordered the 6 ft instead, it was heavy but in 2 pieces, which we didn't like.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Please re-do the installation manual
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are HORRIBLE!!! The company has created a single instruction manual for at least 6 different models of hardware, which would be ok, but they did not organize their thoughts when writing it. With that said, my marriage did survive. My husband and I don’t normally work well together on projects, and this one was no different. We just need some sort of handle and we will have completed this project. It definitely takes 2 people to use this hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Adams

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: This is attractive and very sturdy and for the average DIYer not too big a project. BUT the instructions are not very clear and you need to double and triple check your placements before drilling any holes in your wall or your door. The second time you install this, it will be a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product worked well for what we needed. If given the chance my husband would have welded the two rail pieces together cause it was a pain to get them to line up perfectly level. We custom made these doors and they work great with the equipment and the system does feel very sturdy! We’ve only had them up for a couple weeks but we definitely would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: ELP

customer_reviews.title: Installation space is key.
customer_reviews.text: Love the barn door concept, we used a regular door, and installed this on our new bathroom in our basement. It was however, a bit of a challenge to install but mostly because of our basement construction/constrictions. My husband figured out how to make it work and it's fine. Again, I love the barn door concept, just need ample room to install and utilize it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dear and Darling

customer_reviews.title: Super happy/great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. Our door is looking great! You have to me super good to get any sliding doors on right. So easy?? Not super easy. You do have to have a clue what you are doing, but great quality and I highly recommend we are super happy with the door hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Pierce

customer_reviews.title: great hanger for door
customer_reviews.text: I built a custom barn door with two sided mirrors. my door exceeds the weight for this hardware yet it slides so smooth and easy. all you need is in the kit it looks as good as hardware twice as expensive. several friends have now purchased and all are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Felice Navidad

customer_reviews.title: Quality, quality!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of Smartstandard bam door rail is unsurpassed! The rail, although it's a two person job is quite easy to install, even in the tight situation I had. Packaging was solid and easy to unpack and layout. Good instructions are included and even a couple extra fasteners. Very nice black finish on the rail, that I feel will remain looking great in years to come! If you need a rail consider this one for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get much better than this!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great product! Instructions are a little confusing at first, but once you figure out how to apply all the numbers and measurements, it’s exactly what you need. Rollers are durable, smooth and fairly quiet. Bar is very rigid and durable. I installed for a closet I was building, and it was an exact fit!
customer_reviews.author: OolongT

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these on four occasions now and they are a great product. Home Depot carries something similar for three times the price. In my opinion this is a way better bang for your buck. The hardware is heavy duty and holds solid even with a fairly heavy door.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations!
customer_reviews.text: We have an odd opening (9'x2') that required my husband and I to come up with our own design. He installed the track and hung the door while I was at work. We had to do a few adjustments to square it. The door slides smoothly and quietly. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Rosenbalm

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: I finally found hardware to fit our kneewall closet! I only had 5" of clearance at the top of our door opening and most tracks offer 6" minimum. This worked perfectly! The instructions were so easy to follow. Quality is amazing! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 girls

customer_reviews.title: Good material
customer_reviews.text: Not a one man job. Make sure, if at all possible, to attach a header board to the area you're attaching the door. Also, make sure your floor is level before you determine the height of the rail before you install the kerf. I had to make a kerf out of a different material that was thinner so that the door tracked properly when moved. Burly construction, good product all in all.
customer_reviews.author: Rooday

customer_reviews.title: Door stoppers are broken and dont work!
customer_reviews.text: Went to install door stoppers and the small Screws would not tighten against rail. In fact 2 were falling out the bottom of the screw hole. Sad I went through all that work to only have door stoppers that wouldnt work!
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Measure for yourself
customer_reviews.text: Great overall quality, but be mindful of the provided measurements to install/determine door height; instructions say to add 1 11/16” of an inch to the height of your door to determine the bolt hole location, but this is really not enough. Door barely cleared the floor and needed adjustment. I’d recommend adding 5/8” for a small space on bottom. The other option is to install the door/roller hardware on the door first, measure from the bottom of the door to the inside of the roller and add 1/2 to 5/8 of an inch; this will give you the height of the top of the rail.
customer_reviews.author: GEOFFREY MATTISON

customer_reviews.title: Cool way to hang a door
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price.I use these frequently in my remodeling business. Especially when your limited on space for door swings. My advise would be to supply solid backing in your framing if you have the wall open.The holes very seldom line up where you need them,you can drill new holes in the rail to get to studs.I wouldn't trust the wall anchors supplied in the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Duffecker

product_meta.title: SMARTSTANDARD 6.6ft Heavy Duty Sturdy Sliding Barn Door Hardware Kit -Smoothly and Quietly -Easy to install -Includes Step-By-Step Installation Instruction Fit 36"-40" Wide Door Panel (I Shape Hanger)
feature_bullets: WHY CHOOSE US: With 1/3 of the cost, you can get the same quality products here! This hardware kit are provided along with a completely turnkey experience.
SIMPLE AND EASY TO INSTALL: Professional instruction and customer service team help you solve all installation problems in time. Save the cost of finding a carpenter or decoration team.

PACKAGE INCLUDED: A Barn Door Hardware Kit (2x 3.3FT Rails, 5x Rail Spacers, 2x Rollers, 2x Door Stops,2x End Caps,1x Floor Guide,1x Hex Key; All other necessary hardware is included as you see in the pictures. For 16 inch stud.) DOOR NOT INCLUDED.
DOOR WEIGHT CAPACITY: 220 lb, Fit door panel width: 36"-40", Fit door panel thickness: 1 3/8" and 1 3/4".
RIGHT CHOICE FOR YOUR HOUSE: This modern twist on the classic barn door not only saves space, it allows the ability to open up multiple rooms without the annoyance of a swinging door.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,417 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
